responsibilities.text: Created technical design documents, contributed to product requirements documents, and drove for alignment to ensure successful completion of team initiatives
Owned development of admin-protected features in the Unity Services Dashboard for the OneCommerce initiative, collaborating directly with product to deliver launch-critical functionality
Led migration of legacy MUI v4 components to the Cloud Foundation design system (MUI v5), improving consistency, accessibility, and long-term maintainability across teams
Refactored notifications service and implemented email templates to support OneCommerce Unity Cloud launch
Completed Unity Leadership training and Unity “Certified Interviewer” involved in the intern program
Contributed to MapMyRun (10M+ users) and Seabiscuit, a high-traffic GraphQL-powered product description platform for underarmour.com
Served as primary developer and Product Owner for the Jackfruit challenges admin tool, enabling support teams to launch and manage user challenges without engineering intervention
Implemented test driven development to maintain clean and manageable code, unit testing with Jest
Worked with QA and support team to diagnose and fix bugs
Created and maintained a shared NPM package for unit conversions, reducing duplicated logic and ensuring consistency across multiple applications
Worked under Senior Engineer on Ruby on Rails application utilizing Haml, Sass, Postgres, Redis, RSpec, Codeship, Heroku, and AWS
Effectively translated client requirements into application design and system requirements utilizing Scrum framework
Created admin protected dashboards for business analytics and capturing lost opportunities
Migrated race registration pages from Haml to React single page application to solve state management issues with multi-step form
Increased automated test coverage from 9.22% to 54.49%, significantly improving deployment confidence and production stability
Tech environment: Pivotal Tracker, Ruby on Rails, React, Postgres, Redis, Haml, Sass, AWS, Heroku, RSpec
